column2: The neighbourhood was a dreary one at that time; as oppressive, sad, and solitary by night, as any about London.

column2: There were neither wharves nor houses on the melancholy waste of road near the great blank Prison.

column2: A sluggish ditch deposited its mud at the prison walls.

column2: Coarse grass and rank weeds straggled over all the marshy land in the vicinity.

column2: In one part, carcases of houses, inauspiciously begun and never finished, rotted away.

column2: Slimy gaps and causeways, winding among old wooden piles, with a sickly substance clinging to the latter, like green hair, and the rags of last year's handbills offering rewards for drowned men fluttering above high-water mark, led down through the ooze and slush to the ebb-tide.

column2: Knowing that this state must pass, before we could speak to her with any hope, I ventured to restrain him when he would have raised her, and we stood by in silence until she became more tranquil.
column3: Knowing that this state must pass, before we could speak to her with any hope, I ventured to restrain him when he would have raised her, and we stood by in silence until she became more tranquil.
